results.title: Casual menace
results.brief_description: Sleeping rough in bus shelters and roadside ditches from Darwin to Dubbo, the artists collect a large image-gallery of characters, landscapes, abstractions and moods. Using video and Super 8, they explore the alienating environments of the road and the lonesome souls who travel through these spaces and times. A dark meditation on the nomadic spaces of rural Australia, Casual Menace is composed of two interrelated video loops The Chance Map and Moths. Using the footage gathered from their numerous hitchhiking ‘experiments’, the artists explore the fragile, lonely spaces of remote highways.

results.title: Castles and country: a view of Scotland
results.creator_credit: Shirley Cobham, National Benzole and Random Films
results.brief_description: Illustrates the work of the National Trust for Scotland in preserving castles, palaces, historical sites such as Glencoe, Iona, and the gardens of Crarae, Ardkinglass and Inverewe. Each sequence beings with a close-up, then opens out to a general view enabling appreciation of the architectural line or scene.

results.title: Carrot nose
results.brief_description: Animated puppets are used to tell a story about some children who visit their grandmother at the farm where they build a snow man whose carrot nose is stolen by rabbits who need food in the wintertime.

results.title: The Invisible disability: hearing impairment
results.creator_credit: Alan Foley, Des Pickering and Burwood State College Special Education Film Unit
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Victoria College Special Education Films”.
Hearing impairment is a common disability amongst the community and this documentary aims to make people more aware of this disability. The causes of deafness are discussed and the program stresses the importance of early detection, as language and speech development are seriously affected if help is delayed. Children and parents discuss their problems with communication. Narrated by Barry McQueen.

results.title: Carronbank: Deaf Blind Education
results.creator_credit: Francis Treacey, Des Pickering and Victoria College (Melbourne, Vic.)
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Victoria College Special Education Films”.
A documentary that looks at the education of children with visual and hearing impairment. A very important early stage of education is to teach the children how to communicate and the teachers at Carronbank discuss how this is done. The curriculums, at Carronbank, cater for all needs, including social skills as well as the educational requirements.

results.title: Carmen
results.brief_description: Bizet’s tragic opera, sung in Italian. One of a series of opera films which feature the chorus and orchestra and some of the principals of the Rome Opera House, La Scala, Milan and other famous Italian opera companies. Combines scenes from a performance of the opera with an English language commentary which explains the plot and action.

results.title: Caribbean
results.creator_credit: Central Office of Information, Crown Film Unit
results.brief_description: Made before the Federation of the islands of the West Indies, this film shows the people, customs, export products, social problems, and scenery of the British West Indies, British Guiana, and British Honduras. Interwoven with a musical background of calypso music ritual drumming, ancient folk songs and traditional dance rhythms. (Awards: 1st prize Venice Film Festival 1951)

results.title: Cargo handling at the ports
results.creator_credit: Air Ministry and Great Britain. Ministry of Transport
results.brief_description: Deals with the equipment used in the handling of ships’ cargoes. Among the mechanical appliances shown are various types of crane, pick-up devices, hoppers, conveyors to transport goods from holds to railway trucks, grain elevators, floating elevators, motor tractors and trailers, electric tractors, fork-lift trucks, elevating trucks, the Ross carrier, and power-operated truck mover. Demonstrates how this equipment enables goods to be handled more quickly, so increasing the capacity of the docks.

results.title: Careers in electronic engineering
results.brief_description: A vocational guide to radio, television and electronics. Opens with a discussion on the relative merits of training programs offered by American trade schools, technical institutes, and universities. Explains how the training in electronic theory and practice gained at a technical institute is specially suited for students planning a career in radio, television or electronic engineering. The film shows various aspects of training at the Valparaiso TEchnical Insitute and shows the opportunities which exist for graduates in television, radio, police radio, aviation, marine radio, and electronic engineering.
